item.title: python1
item.description: #this is my R code #install.packages("reticulate", repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") library(reticulate) Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON="/usr/bin/python") use_python("/usr/bin/python") course1 <- "SDS348" #this is my python code course1 = "This semester I am taking computational biology, course number" print(course1, r.course1,".") ## ('This semester I am taking computational biology, course number', 'SDS348', '.')

item.title: Quarantine
item.description: Hello all, I am no longer going crazy in quarantine :D How you may ask? I’ve been listening to some good music, running a lot, baking different breads, listening to podcasts, working on school/ applications… fun stuff!

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Introduction For this project, I will be analyzing the number of arrests for violent crimes and poverty percentage of each of the US states. Because laws and regulations can have a large impact on the safety and status of living of a state, I decided to include the major political party of each state. The examination of these variables can depict any differences/ correlations between Republican vs Democrat states in relation to the violent crimes and poverty percentages.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Modeling 0. (5 pts) Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph. What are they measuring? How many observations? I will be working with my datasets that I worked with in Project 1. Iâ€™ve added data set #4: US States Production, data set #5: the highest reporting type of exercise for adults in each state, data set #6: the obesity levels reported in each state, and data set #7: the death penalty status for each state.
